verbs.description: unjudge (third-person singular simple present unjudges, present participle unjudging, simple past and past participle unjudged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove the judiciary office from (an individual); unseat.
examples: Do justice: to this the judge stands bound in reason, as the proper act of his function: if he be not at leisure to do this, it is time to unjudge him; […]

entries.meaning: (transitive) To undo or remove the judgement from.
examples: I am not come to judge the world, but rather to unjudge it.
